text:
Postinstall script: downloads the prebuilt codeix binary from GitHub Releases.
Zero dependencies — uses Node.js built-in modules only.
Follow redirects (GitHub releases redirect to S3)
Write to temp file then extract with tar (available on macOS/Linux)
Write to temp file then extract with PowerShell (Windows)
Skip if binary already exists (e.g. CI caching)

Don't fail the install — the binary just won't be available
This avoids breaking `npm install` in CI environments that don't need the binary
Download the binary if not cached, return its path.
Entry point: download binary if needed, then exec with forwarded args.
Sticky header: show after scrolling past the hero

Build the index into a database without flushing to disk.
Returns the populated database for immediate use.
Derive project name from directory name
Walk directory to find all files
Process each file through the same path as the watcher
Compute relative path (forward slashes, no leading ./)
Clear any trailing characters from previous longer line
Process file using shared indexing logic
Log errors but continue with other files
Single FTS rebuild after all files

Build the index: scan the directory tree, parse files with tree-sitter,
and write the `.codeindex/` output.
Flush to disk using shared logic
failed to flush index to disk

Run the `build` subcommand: scan the directory tree, parse files with
tree-sitter, and write the `.codeindex/` output.

Run the `serve` subcommand: load the index into an in-memory SQLite FTS5
database and start the MCP server over stdio.
No index exists - build directly into memory and flush to disk
Index exists - read from disk and load into memory
failed to load index into search database
`index.json` manifest — top-level metadata for a `.codeindex/` directory.
One line in `files.jsonl` — metadata for a single indexed file.
One line in `symbols.jsonl` — a symbol extracted from the AST.
One line in `texts.jsonl` — a text block (docstring, comment, etc.).
Convenience alias for the tuple returned by `read_index`.

Read an existing `.codeindex/` directory from disk.
Returns the manifest, files, symbols, and texts.
Read a JSONL file into a Vec of deserialized items.
Write a complete `.codeindex/` directory to disk.
Write symbols.jsonl — sorted by file, then line[0]
Write texts.jsonl — sorted by file, then line[0]
Write a slice of serializable items as JSONL (one JSON object per line).
target/ files should be ignored via matched_path_or_any_parents
target/ should be ignored by walker
Root directory to scan (defaults to current dir)
Start the MCP server (default when no subcommand given)
Interactive: no subcommand given, print help and exit
Piped stdin (e.g. MCP client): default to serve

Top-level declarations: variables, function prototypes, extern declarations
Skip if inside a function body (we only want top-level)
Anonymous struct/union, skip symbol but recurse for comments
The typedef name is typically the last declarator

int add(int a, int b);
extern void print(const char* msg);
Extends C extraction with classes, namespaces, templates, and access specifiers.
Walk class body with access tracking
Default access: private for class, public for struct
namespace::name — use the full qualified name
Functions inside namespaces might be classified as methods
File-scoped namespace: declarations are siblings, not children of body
Walk all siblings after this node
The actual type is the next sibling
Check for modifiers list pattern (some tree-sitter versions)

The receiver is a parameter_list with one entry
Try to extract the type name
Determine kind from the type definition
Handle multiple names in one spec: `var a, b, c int`
First identifier is captured by field "name", subsequent ones need manual check

Interface methods may or may not be extracted depending on implementation
Just verify the interface itself is extracted correctly
at least package + interface

package main

var GlobalVar = 100
var privateVar = 200

const MaxSize = 1000
const minSize = 10

package main

type UserID int
type Handler func(string) error
Shared helpers for tree-sitter extraction across all languages.
Get the text content of a tree-sitter node.
Get the 1-based [start, end] line range for a node.

When end_position().column == 0, the node ends at the start of the next line
(e.g. line_comment includes trailing \n), so the actual end line is the previous row.
don't add 1, since it's actually the previous line
Find a child node by its field name.
Check if a text string is too trivial to index.

Skip short strings that look like code identifiers rather than prose.
Prose typically contains spaces or is substantially longer.
Collapse multiple whitespace characters into single spaces.
Strip `///` or `//!` prefix from each line of a doc comment.
Strip `/* */` delimiters and leading `*` from block comments.
Strip surrounding quotes from string literals.
Extract a comment node as a TextEntry (generic for C-style comments).
Extract a string literal node as a TextEntry.

Extract a function/method signature: everything from start to opening `{` or `:`.
Collapses whitespace.
Check at least one import is extracted
Check if we have any java.util imports
Only index simple identifiers, not destructuring patterns
Check if the value is a function/arrow function
In some grammars, the identifier is a direct child
Return the tree-sitter [`Language`] for the given language name.
Languages are feature-gated — only grammars enabled at compile time are
Detect the language from a file extension.
Recurse into the definition inside the decorator
Check for module-level assignments and docstrings
Determine if it's a method (inside a class) or function
Check for decorators to detect properties, staticmethods, etc.
Recurse into function body for nested definitions
Check for docstring as first statement

Don't recurse deeply into function bodies for symbols,
but do recurse for nested classes/functions
`import foo, bar` or `import foo as bar`
Skip the module name itself (already captured)
Only capture simple identifier assignments (not destructuring, subscripts, etc.)

import os
import sys as system
from pathlib import Path
from typing import List, Dict as D
__special__ starts with _ so it's internal (not __x without trailing __)

\"\"\"Module docstring\"\"\"

def foo():
    \"\"\"Function docstring\"\"\"
    pass

class Bar:
    \"\"\"Class docstring\"\"\"
    pass

def hello(name)
  \"Hello, #{name}!\"
end

def _private_helper
  puts 'private'
end

class Person
  def initialize(name)
    @name = name
  end

  def greet
    \"Hi, #{@name}\"
  end

  def self.create
    Person.new('default')
  end
end

module Utils
  def self.helper
    puts 'helping'
  end
end

module Logger
  class Writer
  end
end

MAX_SIZE = 100
DEFAULT_NAME = 'Unknown'

class Config
  VERSION = '1.0'
end

class Animal
end

class Dog < Animal
  def bark
    'woof'
  end
end

class Utils
  def self.format(text)
    text.upcase
  end
end

# Single line comment
def foo
end

=begin
Multi-line comment
=end
impl is handled recursively inside extract_impl
Walk children of the body to find methods
First is struct, second is impl

pub const MAX: usize = 100;
static GLOBAL: i32 = 0;

Extracts `<script>` blocks from Vue, Svelte, and Astro files so they can
be fed to the existing TypeScript/JavaScript tree-sitter extractors.
No external dependencies — uses simple byte-level scanning.
A script block extracted from an SFC file.
The script content (without the surrounding tags).
The language to parse with: `"typescript"` or `"javascript"`.
1-based line number where the content starts in the original file.
Extract script blocks from an SFC file based on its extension.
Returns an empty vec if no script blocks are found (e.g. template-only
Extract frontmatter: content between first `---` and second `---`
Count lines before the frontmatter content starts
Also extract any <script> tags in the body
Extract all `<script ...>...</script>` blocks from HTML-like source.
`default_lang` is used when no `lang="..."` attribute is present.
Make sure it's actually a tag (next char after "script" should be whitespace or >)
Find the closing > of the opening tag
Content starts after the > (skip leading newline if present)
Find the matching </script> — content ends where the close tag begins
Calculate the 1-based start line of the content
Detect the script language from an opening `<script ...>` tag.
Match lang="ts" or lang="typescript" (with either quote style)
No lang attribute — use the default
Count the number of newline characters in a string slice.

<script lang="ts">
  let count = 0
  function inc() { count++ }
</script>

<button on:click={inc}>{count}</button>
Parse a single file using tree-sitter and extract symbols and text blocks.
SFC preprocessing: extract script blocks from Vue/Svelte/Astro files
For unsupported languages, just extract comments and strings
Merge consecutive doc comments (/// lines) into single entries
Merge consecutive text entries of the same kind on adjacent lines.

Parse an SFC file by extracting script blocks and running them through the
appropriate JS/TS parser, adjusting line numbers back to the original file.
Parse each script block with the detected language
failed to parse {} script block in {}: {}

Adjust line numbers: add the block's start_line offset (minus 1 because
the parser already counts from line 1)

TypeScript extends JavaScript with type annotations, interfaces,
enums, type aliases, and namespaces. We reuse the JS extraction
for most constructs and add TS-specific ones.
--- Shared JS-like extraction (adapted for TS node names) ---
Build signature with type parameters and extends
Walk interface body for method signatures

export type Result<T> = Success<T> | Error;
type ID = string | number;

Compute the BLAKE3 hash of a file's contents, truncated to 64 bits,
returned as a 16-character hex string.

Compute the BLAKE3 hash of byte content, truncated to 64 bits,
returned as a 16-character hex string.
Truncate to first 8 bytes (64 bits), hex-encode to 16 chars

Walk a directory tree using the `ignore` crate (respects `.gitignore`),
returning all file paths that are not ignored.

An in-memory SQLite database with FTS5 virtual tables for fast text search
over the code index.
Create a new in-memory database and initialize the FTS5 schema.
Load index data into the database.
FTS5 search on symbol names, with optional kind and file filters.
FTS5 search on text content, with optional kind and file filters.
FTS5 search on file paths, with optional language filter.
Get all symbols in a file, ordered by start line.
Get direct children of a symbol in a file.
Get all imports for a file (symbols with kind "import").
Get the hash of a file from the DB (for change detection).

Remove all data for a file (from files, symbols, texts tables).
Does not rebuild FTS indexes - caller should call rebuild_fts() after batch operations.

Upsert a single file and its symbols/texts.
Removes old data for this path first, then inserts new data.
Does not rebuild FTS indexes - caller should call rebuild_fts() after batch operations.

Rebuild all FTS5 indexes.
Call this after batch upsert/remove operations.
Export all data from DB back to vecs (for flushing to disk).

Quote a string for use in an FTS5 MATCH expression.
Wraps in double quotes and escapes any internal double quotes.
Filter by symbol kind (e.g. function, struct, class, method)
Filter by language (e.g. python, rust, javascript)
Filter by text kind (e.g. docstring, comment)
File path to get symbols for
File path containing the parent symbol
File path to get imports for
MCP server exposing code-index query tools.

`SearchDb` wraps a `rusqlite::Connection` which is not `Sync`, so we protect
it with a `Mutex` to satisfy rmcp's `Send + Sync` requirements.
Search symbols by name using FTS5 full-text search (BM25-ranked).
Search symbols by name with optional kind/file filters
Search files by path using FTS5 full-text search (BM25-ranked).
Search files by path with optional language filter
Search text entries (docstrings, comments) using FTS5 full-text search (BM25-ranked).
Search text entries (docstrings, comments) with optional kind/file filters
Get all symbols in a file, ordered by line number.
Get all symbols in a file, ordered by line number
Get direct children of a symbol (e.g. methods of a class).
Get direct children of a symbol (e.g. methods of a class)
Get all import statements for a file.
Get all import statements for a file
Start the MCP server over stdio with the given search database.

Start watching the given directory for file changes and trigger
re-indexing when files are modified.
Build gitignore matcher for the root
Create watcher with CORE mask (excludes ACCESS/OPEN events)
Debounce state: path -> last event time
Check for debounced events ready to process
Flush to disk after quiet period
failed to flush index to disk: {}
Handle a batch of file system events.
Skip if gitignored (use matched_path_or_any_parents to check parent dirs like target/)
Rebuild FTS indexes once after all changes
Process a single file change (create or modify).
Parse source files for symbols and texts
Flush the entire index from memory to disk.
Derive project name from directory name
flushed index to disk: {} files, {} symbols, {} texts
Load .gitignore rules from the root directory.
Count the number of lines in a byte buffer.
If file doesn't end with newline, the last line still counts
